intro: Mariscus hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan mariscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its delicate, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish tinge, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
